chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Mindquarry is a web-application that supports your teamwork by combining file sharing, Wiki for knowledge management and collaborative task management.
This user guide will introduce the most important features of the Mindquarry system.

chapter.title: Managing Teams with Mindquarry
chapter.para: With Mindquarry teams you can see your teams and team members. Team managers can invite members.

chapter.title: Managing Files with Mindquarry
chapter.para: Mindquarry file sharing stores all your documents and keeps a history of changes.

tip.title: How to access shared files
tip.para: The files shown in the workspace browser are shared by all team members. In order to edit them and to share your changes, you need to synchronize the shared folder with your desktop. There are three ways to do this:

listitem.para: Using the Mindquarry Desktop Client. The Mindquarry Desktop Client requires Microsoft Windows and Java 5 and synchronizes all your teamspaces with the Mindquarry Collaboration Server automatically. To install the Mindquarry Desktop Client, click the Client link in the footer of this page.
Using the Subversion program. Mindquarry is fully Subversion compatible, meaning you can use any Subversion client like TortoiseSVN, SmartSVN or RapidSVN to synchronize your files.
Using WebDAV. You can use the builtin-WebDAV-support of your operating system to access the shared files and read and write them on the fly.

chapter.title: Sharing Ideas with Mindquarry
chapter.para: The Wiki is your personal idea-store, blackboard and glossary for sharing information and creativity.

chapter.title: Managing Tasks with Mindquarry
chapter.para: With the task management block you can see your todo list and assign tasks to your team members.
